channel.title: Ew
channel.description:
I felt the need to get back into modeling, so I made the first concept i found laying around my desk.
Keep in mind this was made to look like the concept (which is ~3 years old). It was based off of being entirely steel, handle included. Spikes were added too. However, I think it looks like shit but whatever it takes to get me back into this.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/7xqxrXh.png[/img]
Don't expect any updates to this model, I plan to make a few better ones :P But I'm just throwing it out there that yes, I do have plans to return to the modeling scene.

item.title: Ew
item.dc:creator: @jamie0910 jamie0910
item.description:
@jamie0910 wrote:

Looks nice but the handle has spikes on

whoever uses that sword will impale spikes to themselves

looks sort of like a dagger for an ogre or something …sort of like it o_0

item.title: Ew
item.dc:creator: @kirikugi kirikugi
item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

We all have that at some point in time so i can relate. im like that now. Especially with my colors

Read full topic

item.title: Ew
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“kirikugi, post:5, topic:518177”]For a beginner modeler (assuming) im glad to see you arnt recoloring like alot of people and instead you make your very own model with prims none the less. i look forward to seeing you get better. ive seen tons of modelers start worst than you have and become very skilled so im very optimistic for you ^^ thumbs up!![/quote]Lol, I originally joined these forums to model back in 2009, I’m not new to it, just rusty The only reason I haven’t posted anything in a long time was because I kept getting this perfectionist complex, where I’d just delete any progress I made if the model didn’t look exactly how I wanted. This is just to help me get over that, so I’m certainly hoping to post more in my free time

Edit: I’m pretty sure this is the last model I actually put a notable sum of effort into, circa 2011.

Read full topic

item.title: Ew
item.dc:creator: @kirikugi kirikugi
item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

For a beginner modeler (assuming) im glad to see you arnt recoloring like alot of people and instead you make your very own model with prims none the less. i look forward to seeing you get better. ive seen tons of modelers start worst than you have and become very skilled so im very optimistic for you ^^ thumbs up!!

Read full topic

item.title: Ew
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Not bad but I see some pole pinching on that handle. Might want to redo your topology. Glad to hear you are getting back into modelling and hope to see some more great work.

Read full topic

item.title: Ew
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:2, topic:518177”]I think the reason it looks like shit is because it’s entirely disproportional.[/quote]Like I said, I went off an old concept. It was drawn that way Future models/concepts will be better though.

Also, the primary reason I posted this was so I can get over the fact I often trash perfectly good models because they don’t look perfect. I need to get myself comfortable with posting unfinished work again.

Read full topic
